column4: hi, I was installing auto-apt from the console, but it failed somehow, I closed the console and it's still running, how do I stop it (in windows I'd bring up the task manager)
what is still running, apt?
- apt-get
!ot | AW23
it can be dangerous to stop apt-get
are you sure it's frozen up?
no
it might be running
how do I know if it's running... sorry, I just got this yesterday
i suggest you wait a little longer. when you're fed up, do what candrea said, and if that still doesn't work, "sudo killall -9 apt-get"
well try doing "ps aux | grep apt" and look at the CPU percentage
it says it's still trying to install
my apt-get install auto-apt command is there
it's been a few minutes, terminate it?
it seems strange it would freeze...
oh.
I remember why I closed the console
that command eventually brought me to an e-mail setup wizard
which seemed to be in an infinite loop
(why did auto-apt bring me to an e-mail setup?)
try killing it, at this point, but be prepared to have to fiddle to make apt work properly again :\
